intro: Galeopsis elegans, commonly known as slender horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with serrated margins, and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in whorled clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Galeopsis elegans is known for its ability to self-seed prolifically, contributing to its widespread distribution.
